item.title: Malicious Repurposing of Open Science Artefacts by Using Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.18998v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The rapid evolution of large language models (LLMs) has fuelled enthusiasm about their role in advancing scientific discovery, with studies exploring LLMs that autonomously generate and evaluate novel research ideas. However, little attention has been...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, API, model, tool, research | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: LLM Driven Design of Continuous Optimization Problems with Controllable High-level Properties
item.description: arXiv:2601.18846v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Benchmarking in continuous black-box optimisation is hindered by the limited structural diversity of existing test suites such as BBOB. We explore whether large language models embedded in an evolutionary loop can be used to design optimisation proble...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, model, embedding, framework, multimodal | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: More at Stake: How Payoff and Language Shape LLM Agent Strategies in Cooperation Dilemmas
item.description: arXiv:2601.19082v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As LLMs increasingly act as autonomous agents in interactive and multi-agent settings, understanding their strategic behavior is critical for safety, coordination, and AI-driven social and economic systems. We investigate how payoff magnitude and ling...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, LLM, model, framework, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Exploring Weaknesses in Function Call Models via Reinforcement Learning: An Adversarial Data Augmentation Approach
item.description: arXiv:2601.19122v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Function call capabilities have become crucial for Large Language Models (LLMs), enabling them to interact more effectively with external tools and APIs. Existing methods for improving the function call capabilities of LLMs rely on data obtained eithe...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, API, model, tool, framework | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> context, prompt, LLM, API, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
